tips.li: Press B to view temperature map. You can change the hotkey in the settings.
Heat capacity defines how much energy is needed to change an object's temperature and depends on the stuff it's made of.
In cold biomes, build walls from good insulators, like wood or plasteel, to keep the heat. Steel insulates poorly.
Fires and heaters can melt ice. If ice melts under a building, it is usually destroyed. Pawns may also drown in deep water.
Thin (e.g. constructed) roofs are not perfect insulators and will let some heat through.
Many flammable materials will spontaneously catch fire (autoignite) if exposed to high temperatures.
Pawns get cold easier when wet or under strong wind. Direct sunlight, on the contrary, helps pawns warm up.
